Location: <img alt="United Kingdom" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600"> Strabane, Northern Ireland
Details: A bomb exploded in the town of Strabane, Northern Ireland. The device detonated while Police Service of Northern Ireland officers were on patrol in the area. No one was killed or injured in the attack. Dissident Irish Republicans are being blamed for the attack.[75]

Location: <img alt="Philippines" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="450"> Sultan Kudarat, Philippines
Details: At least one marine was killed and other nine were wounded in a NPA ambush in Sultan Kudarat,Philippines.[76]

Location: <img alt="Turkey" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Flag_of_Turkey.svg/23px-Flag_of_Turkey.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800"> Hakkari, Turkey
Details: A Turkish soldier was killed and four others were wounded in an armed attack carried out by PKK militants at the Gerkitepe Base defense zone in the district of Çukurca in southeastern Hakkari province.[77]

Location: <img alt="Ukraine" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Ukraine.svg/23px-Flag_of_Ukraine.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800"> Donetsk, Ukraine
Details: In the city of Donetsk, a group of pro-Russian supporters attacked the headquarters of the local football team.[78]

Location: <img alt="Nigeria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Flag_of_Nigeria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Nigeria.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="400"> Maiduguri, Nigeria
Details: 2017 Maiduguri attack: At least eight people have been killed in multiple suicide blasts along a highway in Maiduguri.[79]

Location: <img alt="United Kingdom" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600"> London, United Kingdom
Details: 2017 Westminster attack: 52 year old Khalid Masood drove into pedestrians on Westminster Bridge, killing four and causing numerous injuries before crashing the car into the railings of the Palace of Westminster. The attacker then fled from the vehicle and attempted to gain access through the Palace gates, fatally stabbing a police officer before being shot dead by a plain clothes police officer. In total there were 49 injuries reported, 30 of which required hospital treatment, 7 of which were critical.[80][81][82]

Location: <img alt="Pakistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/32/Flag_of_Pakistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Pakistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Orakzai, Pakistan
Details: Military officials in Pakistan say a gunfight with militants killed two soldiers and five “terrorists” in a volatile northwestern region. Separately, a roadside bomb hit a security convoy, killing one person, near the Afghan border in the neighboring South Waziristan tribal district.[83]

Location: <img alt="Egypt" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Flag_of_Egypt.svg/23px-Flag_of_Egypt.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Sinai, Egypt
Details: Ten members of Egypt's security forces were killed when their vehicles were hit by two improvised bombs during a military operation against suspected militants in the Sinai peninsula. 15 militants were also killed.[84]

Location: <img alt="Ukraine" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Ukraine.svg/23px-Flag_of_Ukraine.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800"> Kiev, Ukraine
Details: Former Russian politician Denis Voronenkov was shot and killed in Kiev. His assailant was wounded by Voronenkov's bodyguard and taken to hospital, where he later died from his wounds, according to the authorities. Voronenko's bodyguard was also wounded during the incident.[85]

Location: <img alt="Somalia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Flag_of_Somalia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Somalia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Mogadishu, Somalia
Details: A car bomb blast near a restaurant and hotel in Mogadishu has killed at least one person and wounded two others.[86]

Location: <img alt="Russia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/f/f3/Flag_of_Russia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Russia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Naurskaya, Russia
Details: A group of 8 jihadists attacked a military base of the National Guard of Russia near Grozny in Chechnya. During the assault, six soldiers were killed, as well as 6 terrorists.[87]

Location: <img alt="Bangladesh" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Flag_of_Bangladesh.svg/23px-Flag_of_Bangladesh.svg.png" width="23" height="14" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="500" data-file-height="300"> Dhaka, Bangladesh
Details: A suicide bomber blew himself up in the Shahjalal International Airport causing no injuries. Islamic State claims the attack.[88]

Location: <img alt="Colombia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Flag_of_Colombia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Colombia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Arauca, Colombia
Details: Two wounded soldiers left in an attack apparently from ELN guerrillas in the department of Arauca. In an another operation the leader of an ELN front died next to his escort, inform the army.[89][90]

Location: <img alt="Egypt" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Flag_of_Egypt.svg/23px-Flag_of_Egypt.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Arish, Egypt
Details: Egyptian security officials said Saturday that a roadside bomb planted by suspected Islamic militants had hit a police armored vehicle in the north of the Sinai Peninsula, killing three members of the security forces and injuring six others.[91]

Location: <img alt="Democratic Republic of the Congo" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6f/Flag_of_the_Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo.svg/20px-Flag_of_the_Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo.svg.png" width="20" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="600"> Tshikapa, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: 2017 Congolese police decapitation attacks: Rebel fighters have killed at least 40 policemen in the central Democratic Republic of Congo, in one of the deadliest attacks on security forces since a violent uprising began late last year. The Kamwina Nsapu militia reportedly killed the police officers on Saturday and only spared those who spoke their local language.[92]

Location: <img alt="Bangladesh" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/Flag_of_Bangladesh.svg/23px-Flag_of_Bangladesh.svg.png" width="23" height="14" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="500" data-file-height="300"> South Surma Upazila, Bangladesh
Details: 2017 South Surma Upazila bombings: A suicide bombing killed 7 (four civilians and three police officers) and wounded more than 40 in South Surma Upazila, Bangladesh. Later, other bombs exploded and gunfire have occurred. Islamic State claimed responsibility. Three militants were also killed.[93][94]

Location: <img alt="United States" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1235" data-file-height="650"> New York City, United States
Details: Stabbing of Timothy Caughman: James Harris Jackson, a white supremacist, stabbed an African-American to death in New York. He revealed that he planned larger attacks against black men in New York's Times Square.[95]

Location: <img alt="Colombia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Flag_of_Colombia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Colombia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Fortul, Arauca District, Colombia
Details: A subcommander from the Fortul Police Station was shot dead in a sniper attack in the locality of Fortul, in the Arauca District.[96]

Location: <img alt="Pakistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/32/Flag_of_Pakistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Pakistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Lyari, Pakistan
Details: At least 12 people were injured on Saturday evening in a grenade attack in the Lyari area of Karachi.[97][98]

Location: <img alt="Philippines" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="450"> Sulu, Philippines
Details: At least four people were killed and 23 others wounded in a grenade attack in the southern Philippines.[99]

Location: <img alt="Colombia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Flag_of_Colombia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Colombia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Chocó, Colombia
Details: At least five people were killed in an attack in the locality of San juan in Chocó Department.[100]

Location: <img alt="South Sudan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7a/Flag_of_South_Sudan.svg/23px-Flag_of_South_Sudan.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1000" data-file-height="500"> Juba, South Sudan
Details: Six aid workers have been killed in an ambush in South Sudan, the United Nations said on Sunday, without specifying what organisation they worked for. The victims were attacked on Saturday as they travelled from the capital, Juba, to the eastern town of Pibor, according to the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA).[101]

Location: <img alt="Yemen" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Flag_of_Yemen.svg/23px-Flag_of_Yemen.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Lahj Governorate, Yemen
Details: At least six security personnel and four civilians were killed in a suicide car-bomb attack and subsequent shooting in Yemen’s southern Lahj province. Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula later claimed responsibility.[102]

Location: <img alt="Philippines" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="450"> Zamboanga, Philippines
Details: The vice mayor of Sumisip Town, Basilan escaped unscathed, but his two security escorts were wounded in a roadside bombing perpetrated by suspected Abu Sayyaf militants.[103]

Location: <img alt="Egypt" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Flag_of_Egypt.svg/23px-Flag_of_Egypt.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Sinai, Egypt
Details: Two elderly men were executed for 'witchcraft' and 'apostasy' by Islamic State militants.[104]

Location: <img alt="Mali" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Mali.svg/23px-Flag_of_Mali.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Boulikessi, Mali

Location: <img alt="Somalia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Flag_of_Somalia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Somalia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Qandala, Somalia
Details: One soldier was killed and another was injured in a roadside bombing near the town of Qandala. The attack was blamed by regional military officials on Islamic State-affiliated militants.[106]

Location: <img alt="India" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/41/Flag_of_India.svg/23px-Flag_of_India.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1350" data-file-height="900"> Chadoora, India
Details: A militant and three civilians were killed in an encounter with the security forces in Chadoora area of Budgam district of central Kashmir today.[107]

Location: <img alt="Philippines" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="450"> Maguindanao, Philippines

Location: <img alt="Colombia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Flag_of_Colombia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Colombia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Arauca, Colombia
Details: At least two soldiers were killed and other three injured in an ambush by ELN militants.[109]

Location: <img alt="Democratic Republic of the Congo" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6f/Flag_of_the_Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo.svg/20px-Flag_of_the_Democratic_Republic_of_the_Congo.svg.png" width="20" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="600"> Kasai province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: The bodies of two (one of the two was beheaded) UN experts and their Congolese interpreter who went missing in the Democratic Republic of Congo this month have been found, the United Nations said in a statement Tuesday.[110]

Location: <img alt="Ukraine" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Ukraine.svg/23px-Flag_of_Ukraine.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800"> Lutsk, Ukraine
Details: The Polish consulate in Lutsk was attacked with a grenade launcher.[111][112]

Location: <img alt="Iraq" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Flag_of_Iraq.svg/23px-Flag_of_Iraq.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="411" data-file-height="274"> Baghdad, Iraq
Details: A suicide truck bomber targeted a police checkpoint in southern Baghdad, killing 17 people and injuring at least 60 others.[113]

Location: <img alt="Syria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Flag_of_Syria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Syria.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Homs, Syria
Details: A bomb blast hit a passenger bus in the city of Homs, Syria killing five people and wounding six.[114]

Location: <img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg/23px-Flag_of_Belgium_%28civil%29.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Brussels, Belgium

Location: <img alt="Pakistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/32/Flag_of_Pakistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Pakistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Nankana, Pakistan
Details: A prominent member of Ahmadi community was killed in an attack claimed by Lashkar-e-Jhangvi.[116]

Location: <img alt="Nigeria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Flag_of_Nigeria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Nigeria.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="400"> Kubuwa village, Nigeria
Details: Boko Haram ambushed Dangote trucks, killing three persons, including two drivers, and injuring three others at Kubuwa village.[117]

Location: <img alt="Nigeria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Flag_of_Nigeria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Nigeria.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="400"> Damboa, Nigeria
Details: 12 people were killed in multiple Boko Haram attacks on Wumyeduga village. 23 people were also injured in the multiple attacks, which involved the detonation of explosives by a suspected female suicide bomber at the village’s cemetery.[117]

Location: <img alt="Thailand" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Flag_of_Thailand.svg/23px-Flag_of_Thailand.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Yala and Narathiwat, Thailand
Details: An army ranger and a policeman were shot dead in Thailand's deep south. Separately, five gunmen opened fire at a police station in Narathiwat province, killing a policeman and wounding three others.[118]

Location: <img alt="Pakistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/32/Flag_of_Pakistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Pakistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Parachinar, Pakistan
Details: March 2017 Parachinar suicide bombing: At least 24 people have been killed and more than 70 injured in a blast outside a mosque in north-west Pakistan. Jamaat-ul-Ahrar claimed responsibility for the attack.[119]

Location: <img alt="Philippines" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="450"> North Cotabato, Philippines
Details: An improvised explosive device went off at a roadside in Midsayap, North Cotabato before dawn on Saturday wounding a pedicab driver. A minor was injured.[120]

Location: <img alt="Ukraine" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Ukraine.svg/23px-Flag_of_Ukraine.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="800"> Mariupol, Ukraine
Details: SBU colonel was killed in a car explosion in Mariupol.[121]

Location: <img alt="Niger" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f4/Flag_of_Niger.svg/18px-Flag_of_Niger.svg.png" width="18" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="700" data-file-height="600"> Diffa, Niger
Details: A Nigerian soldier was killed and 11 were injured in a Boko Haram attack. Three militants were also killed.[122]
